initial_story:
Firefighters and police were seen outside the office of Mike Freer MP

Police are investigating a suspected arson attack at the office of North London Conservative MP Mike Freer.

A fire broke out at the rear of the North Finchley and Golders Green MP's constituency office at around 19:00 on Christmas Eve.

The Met Police confirmed it is investigating the fire.

Mr Freer told the BBC the fire happened at the rear of the premises and no one was in the building at the time of the incident.

He continued: "The police and fire brigade were on the scene in minutes and have been incredible in their response."

London Fire Brigade (LFB) confirmed the fire started in a shed outside the office before spreading to the rest of the building.

An LFB spokesperson said: "An external shed was destroyed by fire. Part of the first, second and third floors of the property were also damaged by the blaze."

In a statement, a Metropolitan Police spokesperson said: "The cause of the fire is under investigation as it is believed it may have been started deliberately. There have been no arrests."

Pictures posted on social media showed Metropolitan Police and LFB vehicles at the premises on Sunday evening.

Mr Freer has represented the North London constituency since 2010.

He is parliamentary under-secretary of state for courts and legal services, a junior role in the Ministry of Justice.

Pictures show the fire spread to an office inside the building
stories: The office, which is located on a busy high street, was cordoned off by police tape, with forensic officers seen collecting evidence from the scene. Neighbors reported hearing a loud bang and seeing flames licking at the windows of the office building. "It was terrifying," said one local resident. "I was just watching TV when I heard the explosion. I looked out the window and saw the flames. I'm just glad no one was hurt." The incident has sparked concerns about the safety of MPs and their staff, coming just months after the murder of Conservative MP Sir David Amess. Mr Freer has been praised for his response to the incident, with colleagues taking to social media to express their support. "Shocked and relieved to hear that Mike Freer's office was targeted in a suspected arson attack," tweeted one MP. "Thanks to the emergency services for their swift response. Mike is a dedicated public servant and this will not deter him from serving his constituents." The investigation into the incident is ongoing, with police urging anyone with information to come forward.

As the news of the attack spread, MPs from across the political spectrum condemned the incident, with many calling for increased security measures to protect elected officials and their staff. The Home Secretary is set to make a statement in Parliament later today, addressing concerns about the safety of MPs and outlining steps being taken to prevent similar incidents in the future. Meanwhile, Mr. Freer has thanked his constituents for their support, saying that he is "shaken but resolute" and will continue to serve the community with "unwavering dedication". The incident has also sparked a wider debate about the tone of political discourse and the potential consequences of inflammatory rhetoric.

Some have pointed to the increasing polarization of politics and the rise of social media as contributing factors to the growing hostility towards elected officials, while others have argued that the attack was an isolated incident and not representative of the broader political climate. The leader of the opposition has called for a cross-party committee to investigate the incident and make recommendations on how to improve the safety of MPs, while the Prime Minister has announced plans to increase funding for security measures in constituencies. As the investigation into the attack continues, attention is also turning to the suspect, who has been named as 25-year-old Thomas Johnson, a local man with a history of mental health issues and a fascination with extremist ideologies.

Neighbors and acquaintances of Johnson have described him as a quiet and introverted individual who kept to himself, but online activity suggests a darker persona, with a trail of inflammatory posts and comments on social media platforms. His family has released a statement expressing shock and sadness at the events, and cooperating fully with the authorities. Meanwhile, questions are being raised about how Johnson was able to carry out the attack despite his history of mental health issues, with some calling for a review of the mental health services in the area. The local police force has confirmed that Johnson was known to them, having been arrested on several occasions for minor offenses, but was not considered a high-risk individual. As the community struggles to come to terms with the attack, a candlelit vigil is planned for tonight to show support for the injured MP and to promote a message of peace and unity.

The vigil, which is expected to be attended by local leaders and community members, will take place outside the hospital where the MP is currently being treated. The MP's condition remains critical, but stable, according to the latest update from the hospital. In the aftermath of the attack, many are left wondering how this could have happened in their quiet, suburban community. "It's just shocking," said one neighbor, who wished to remain anonymous. "You never think something like this could happen right in your own backyard." The police investigation is ongoing, with detectives combing through Johnson's online activity and speaking to those who knew him to piece together a motive for the attack. As the community grapples with the reality of what happened, there are also concerns about the impact on the nation as a whole, with some calling for increased security measures for public figures.

Prime Minister Rachel Morse has already spoken out about the attack, calling it a "heinous act of violence" and assuring the public that her government is doing everything in its power to ensure the safety of its elected officials. But for now, the community remains in shock, struggling to come to terms with the senseless violence that has shaken it to its core.

Neighborhood residents who witnessed the attack are still trying to process what they saw, with many describing the scene as "chaotic" and "horrific". The local police department has set up a hotline for anyone who may have information about the attack, and detectives are working around the clock to piece together the events leading up to the shooting.
